perturbation.original_text: This Endorsement Agreement ("Agreement") is made this 13th day of October, 1999 by and between SQUARE TWO GOLF INC., a New Jersey corporation (the "Company"), and KATHY WHITWORTH, an individual, with an address at 302 La Mancha Court, Santa Fe, New Mexico, 87501 (the "Professional").
perturbation.changed_text: This Endorsement Agreement ("Contract") is made this 13th day of October, 1999 by and between SQUARE TWO GOLF INC., a New Jersey corporation (the "Company"), and KATHY WHITWORTH, an individual, with an address at 302 La Mancha Court, Santa Fe, New Mexico, 87501 (the "Athlete").
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Agreement' to 'Contract' and 'Professional' to 'Athlete' creates confusion as the document refers to both 'Agreement' and 'Contract,' and 'Professional' and 'Athlete' without clarifying if they are interchangeable. This leads to uncertainty in interpreting the obligations of the parties.

perturbation.original_text: 2. ENDORSEMENT SERVICES. During the Term, the Professional will provide the services described in this Section 2 (the "Services"): 2.1 The Professional hereby grants to the Company an exclusive license to use her name, likeness, image and personal identification, singly or in any combination, in connection with the production, use, marketing and sale of a "Kathy Whitworth" signature line of women's golf clubs (the "Products"), as described more fully in Section 3 below.
perturbation.changed_text: 2. ENDORSEMENT SERVICES. During the Term, the Athlete will provide the services described in this Section 2 (the "Duties"): 2.1 The Athlete hereby grants to the Company an exclusive license to use her name, likeness, image and personal identification, singly or in any combination, in connection with the production, use, marketing and sale of a "Kathy Whitworth" signature line of women's golf clubs (the "Items"), as described more fully in Section 3 below.
perturbation.explanation: The switch from 'Services' to 'Duties' and 'Products' to 'Items' introduces ambiguity. It is no longer clear whether the scope of 'Duties' is identical to that of 'Services' or whether the 'Items' are referring to a completely different set of products, as previously defined.

perturbation.original_text: 4. COMPENSATION FOR ENDORSEMENT SERVICES. 4.1 The Company will pay the Professional a base fee of thirty-six thousand dollars ($36,000) per year (the "Base Fee") for Services performed during the Term. The Company shall pay the Base Fee in four (4) equal installments of nine thousand dollars ($9,000) each on March 15, June 15, September 15 and December 15 of each year during the Term commencing on January 15, 2000.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. COMPENSATION FOR ENDORSEMENT SERVICES. 4.1 The Company will pay the Athlete a base remuneration of thirty-six thousand dollars ($36,000) per year (the "Base Fee") for Duties performed during the Term. The Company shall pay the Base Fee in twelve (12) equal installments of three thousand dollars ($3,000) each on the last day of each month during the Term commencing on January 31, 2000.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'fee' to 'remuneration' and specifying the payments to be monthly instead of quarterly introduces a significant contradiction, particularly concerning the payment schedule. The reader is left uncertain about the correct payment frequency and the total amounts due per period.
